JobFullDesc: Job DescriptionTHE ROLE: The Customer Success Manager (CSM) works proactively with a portfolio of accounts across APAC (typically $20k and over) in close connection with LogMeIn’s sales, marketing, renewals, and inbound care teams.  You will drive success and continued value for our customers through their life cycle, with a focus on growth, risk mitigation, retention and customer happiness.  The CSM will work with customers of all sizes, from SMB through to Enterprise and will work across all lines of LogMeIn business, with a primary focus on our UCC productsPrincipal responsibilities: Develop excellent customer relationships to drive ROI, growth, retention, and high customer satisfaction. Navigate customer’s organisation to deepen strong relationships with key decisions makers and to strengthen understanding of business needs/drivers Build a strong relationship with sales partners to jointly represent LogMeIn as a unified Account Team that supports and manages each customer Develop tactical Account Plans collaboratively with Account Team Responsible for risk identification, escalation, and mitigation planning & execution Identify incremental opportunities within and across other business units; works closely with Sales to pursue and win these Lead monthly and/or quarterly business reviews with customers, reinforcing ROI and identifying innovative solutions to solve critical business problems Manage all customer projects, including more complex implementations Gather product feedback and customer needs and recommends improvements to Product Teams, ensuring customer needs are heard throughout LogMeIn Effectively navigate internally and cross-functionally to ensure customer needs and business needs are met Facilitate executive relationships between LogMeIn and the customer through introductions and coordination of conference calls and on-site visits Meet or exceed KPIs and goals, as set by LogMeIn and Customer Success leadership.WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?:We are seeking a customer obsessed individual who thrives on relationship building and driving customer engagement and adoption; amongst a range of different stakeholder types. The ideal candidate will have experience in customer success or transferrable skills (e.g. from Renewals, Sales/Account Management) and will pride themselves on thinking outside the box to tackle problems creatively.The successful candidate will also exhibit strong project management and organisational skills, with the ability to translate the analysis of complex data into meaningful information that aligns with customer needs. It is critical that the candidate has strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively present business concepts and communicate to all levels of an organisation.
